docs.lead_paragraph: Hi. Welcome to On Politics, your guide to the day in national politics. I’m Lisa Lerer, your host.

docs.abstract: Mr. Yang is no fan of the president. But his coalition includes conservatives who see nonpartisan logic in his message about automation and job loss.

docs.abstract: Twelve Democratic presidential candidates shared the stage in Ohio for the fourth televised primary debate.
docs.snippet: Twelve Democratic presidential candidates shared the stage in Ohio for the fourth televised primary debate.
docs.lead_paragraph: Former Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. and Senator Elizabeth Warren got into a direct confrontation late in the debate on Tuesday night as the pair of Democratic front-runners compared their achievements in office and traded barbs.

headline.main: Joe Biden Stresses His Part in Elizabeth Warren’s Signature Accomplishment

docs.abstract: It was the first time the former vice president expressed support for full impeachment. He had previously backed a congressional inquiry.
docs.snippet: It was the first time the former vice president expressed support for full impeachment. He had previously backed a congressional inquiry.
docs.lead_paragraph: ROCHESTER, N.H. — Joseph R. Biden Jr. on Wednesday called for President Trump’s impeachment for the first time, blistering Mr. Trump as a threat to American democracy and accusing him of “shooting holes in the Constitution.”

headline.main: Biden Calls for Trump Impeachment for First Time
headline.print_headline: Biden Voices Support For Impeaching Trump, Ending Long Restraint

docs.abstract: The Democratic presidential candidates agree on many gun control measures, like an assault weapons ban. But they’re split on other ideas, like a federal gun registry.
docs.snippet: The Democratic presidential candidates agree on many gun control measures, like an assault weapons ban. But they’re split on other ideas, like a federal gun registry.
docs.lead_paragraph: The 2020 Democratic presidential candidates are far more forceful and united on gun control than their predecessors, endorsing a wide range of policies that past nominees sidestepped or rejected, according to a New York Times survey of the 19 campaigns.

headline.main: We Surveyed the 2020 Democrats on Gun Control. Here Are the New Dividing Lines.
headline.print_headline: Where the 2020 Democrats Stand  On Gun Control Proposals

docs.abstract: Polls show Democrats broadly support liberal policies like the Green New Deal and an assault weapons ban. Health care is a major concern for many.
docs.snippet: Polls show Democrats broadly support liberal policies like the Green New Deal and an assault weapons ban. Health care is a major concern for many.
docs.lead_paragraph: When they tune into Tuesday night’s CNN/New York Times Debate, what will Democratic voters be hoping to see? And what can opinion polls tell us about where the primary electorate stands on the issues?

headline.main: As Debate Nears, Where Do Democratic Voters Stand on the Issues?
headline.print_headline: One Concern Over Any Other: Candidate Who Can Beat Trump
